title: DOC: pytest.mark.parametrize on class definition should be documented

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: documentation improvement, missing or needing clarification

body:
<!--
Thanks for suggesting a feature!

Quick check-list while suggesting features:
-->

#### What's the problem this feature will solve?
<!-- What are you trying to do, that you are unable to achieve with pytest as it currently stands? -->

Using `pytest.mark.parametrize` on class definition should be documented. It is mentioned in https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17434031/parametrizing-test-classes-in-pytest/ (the second answer) and it works, but I cannot find it hinted at https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/main/doc/en/example/parametrize.rst . All the existing example involving classes are way too complicated for the particular usage I am looking for.

```python
import pytest


@pytest.mark.parametrize('x', [1, 2])
class TestMe:
    def test_1(self, x):
        print(f'test 1: {x}')

    def test_2(self, x):
        print(f'test 2: {x}')
```

gives me correctly:

```
test 1: 1
test 1: 2
test 2: 1
test 2: 2
```

But since it is not documented, is it only working by accident? Or it is actually supported?

#### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->

<!-- Provide examples of real-world use cases that this would enable and how it solves the problem described above. -->

Document it if it is actually a supported usage.

#### Alternative Solutions
<!-- Have you tried to workaround the problem using a pytest plugin or other tools? Or a different approach to solving this issue? Please elaborate here. -->

Disallow it if it is not actually a supported usage.
